application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
secondary_street_name: HAVERSTOCK ROAD, PRINCE OF WALES ROAD
description:
Outline application for the redevelopment of the site for a
new 1250 place Secondary School and residential development
as shown on drawing numbers 2067/1A, 2067/5. The following
drawings are also submitted for indicative purposes only;
2067/2, 2067/4.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Details of all existing trees on site (and bordering the site within 10 metres) with a stem diameter of 75mm or greater shall be supplied to the Council prior to the consideration of detailed proposals and shall include the following information: Location, species, reference number, stem diameter at 1.5 metres above ground level, height and accurate crown spread. Where nearby excavations are proposed, the level at the base of each tree shall be included. Trees to be removed in conjunction with the proposed development should be indicated as such and, where appropriate the proposed positions and lines of protective fencing and prohibited areas should be shown. 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No part of the non-affordable element of the residential
    development hereby approved shall be occupied until all the
    school buildings have been completed and are ready for
    occupation.

Condition : 3 - A Green Travel Plan relating to the travel patterns of both
    � Raising travel awareness (healthy travel campaigns, travel
    information provision)
    � Promotion of low or zero emission vehicle use/ownership
    � Facilities (secure, convenient pedestrian and cyclist
    facilities)
    � Freight management (co-ordination of deliveries to site
    where possible to reduce frequency of journeys)
    Promoting less travel overall and particularly fewer car
    trips by a range of incentives and restrictions (eg. season
    ticket loans to staff, etc.)
    students and staff shall be submitted to and approved by the
    
    Within one year of first occupation of the new school
    buildings, the school shall not be occupied other than in
    accordance with the terms of the Green Travel Plan as
    approved.
    Council prior to the first occupation of the School
    buildings. The Plan shall include:
    
    Identification of a designated person to coordinate the
    following issues:
    � Annual travel surveys and trip planning for staff and
    pupils

Condition : 4 - A method statement relating to a scheme for deliveries to
    and from the site throughout the works phase(s) shall be
    submitted to the Planning Authority and agreed in writing
    before such works commence. All on-site works and traffic
    movements associated with them, shall not be conducted other
    than in accordance with such scheme as is approved.

Condition : 5 - Not less than 50% of the habitable rooms contained in the
    residential element of the development shall be provided as
    affordable housing, with at least 35% of the total provided
    by a registered social landlord (RSL) for rent.

Condition : 6 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 7 - To ensure that the development facilitates the improvement
    of the existing school facilities on the site in accordance
    with policies SC1 and SC8 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - To promote public transport and sustainable travel
    alternatives in accordance with policies TR2 and TR3 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - In order to protect the general amenities of the surrounding
    area in accordance with policy EN7 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - In order to comply with the requirements of policy HG11 of
    the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    Alteration No. 2 Suggested Amendments June 2002.

Condition : 11 - The selected contractor in respect of the residential
    right to nominate occupiers and 15% can be intermediate/
    essential worker housing. The Agreement may, depending to
    the parking arrangements proposed for the residential
    element, also require the housing to be provided on a car-
    free or car capped basis. This Agreement will be attached to
    the detailed application relating to the relevant part(s) of
    the reserved matters to this outline permission.
    development hereby approved will be expected to enter into a
    legal agreement under Section 106 of the Town and Country
    Planning Act 1990 to ensure that at least 50% of (the
    habitable rooms contained in) the residential accommodation
    is permanently retained as affordable housing. Under the
    Council's current interim policy this should comprise at
    least 35% affordable housing for rent provided by a
    registered housing association with the Council having the

Condition : 12 - The reserved matters application(s) relating to the design,
    access and internal layout of the buildings will be expected
    to be accompanied by a BREEAM assessment. For further
    information please refer to paragraph 1.3.13 of the
    Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance 2002.

Condition : 13 - You are advised that unless it is possible to comply with
    the Council's policies and standards in respect of
    residential car parking, the Council will expect the
    development to be "car free" in accordance with the London
    Borough of Camden's Unitary Development Plan Policy TR16.
